title: Expediting the investigations and inquiries pertaining to goods detained by the Sri Lanka Customs
decision_details:
- It has been observed that a long time is taken to complete the investigation, inquiries and other related processes pertaining to goods including vehicles, detained by the Sri Lanka Customs. As this results in many economic losses including damage and destruction to such goods, it is important to expedite the existing processes followed by the Sri Lanka Customs on such detained goods. Accordingly, the Cabinet decided to grant its concurrence for the measures taken by the Hon. President to appoint a Ministerial Committee consisted with the following composition to study those matters and identify the amendments to be made to the Customs Ordinance if any and to submit recommendations on that regard to the Cabinet.

* 	Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva
	Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation

*	Hon. (Dr.) Ramesh Pathirana
	Minister of Plantation Industries and Minister of Industries

*	Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapitiya 
	State Minister of Finance

*	Hon. Dilum Amunugama
	State Minister of InvestmentPromotion

*	Hon. Shehan Semasinghe 
	State Minister of Finance
